message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product. I know it's worth a lot to you, and I'm confident it'll be a valuable asset. My initial offer is $1,400,000. Let me know your thoughts.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. Can you meet me at that price?
Bob, I appreciate your interest. While I understand your offer, $1,200,000 is a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to come down to $1,300,000. Let's see if we can find some common ground.
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I still think $1,300,000 is a bit too high for me. I'm willing to go up to $1,250,000. Can you meet me in the middle?
Bob, I'm still not quite there yet.  I'm willing to come down to $1,275,000. That's a significant concession on my part, but I'm hoping we can reach an agreement.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I still think $1,275,000 is a bit too high. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $1,225,000. Can we shake on it at this price?
Bob, I understand we're close.  To make this happen, I'm willing to go down to $1,250,000. It's a good price for both of us, and I think we can finalize this deal.
I think we're really close now. I'm willing to meet you at $1,225,000, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,200,000. Can we make it happen at this price?
Bob, I appreciate your persistence. I'm willing to go down to $1,225,000. This is my final offer, as I'm not sure I can go any lower.

I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with $1,225,000. I'm willing to make one last attempt to meet in the middle. I'll offer $1,200,000, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to explore other options.
